title: Rose McGowan brands Piers Morgan ‘dense and archaic’ as he takes break from GMB
text:
Rose McGowan brands Piers Morgan ‘dense and archaic’ (Picture: Getty / Rex)

Rose McGowan has branded Piers Morgan dense and archaic after the presenter expressed his views on gender.

Ahead of the Q Awards in London, last night, the 46-year-old spoke to Metro.co.uk about the controversial star.

And while reassuring the fact that the father-of-four is an ‘admirable man’ in real life, the activist went and took aim at his onscreen character.

‘That’s Piers’ shtick,’ she told use when we asked about her thoughts on the current saga, which has seen viewers sign petitions to get the 56-year-old sacked.

‘I hope he doesn’t believe it, because it’s dense and archaic,’ Rose continued: ‘But I think Piers is always going to be Piers, and people like me will always be people like me fighting for women.’

She added: ‘And that’s what I do and that’s what he does.’

She was attending the Q Awards (Picture: Getty Images)

Piers is currently on holiday after announcing he would be taking a couple of weeks off as of today.

As the credits started to roll, on Wednesday’s episode, he told viewers at home: ‘Good Morning Britain is back tomorrow. I’m not. I’ll see you in a couple of weeks. Bye.’

His break from the screen comes days after the ITV daytime series launched a Twitter poll on Monday (14 October) to see whether fans wanted to keep Piers onscreen.

Over the course of the past two days, 482,270 voted, with 60 per cent agreeing that the star should be booted off.

‘It’s now been hijacked by these snowflake websites and Twitter handles, so all last night they were like, “We’ve got to get rid of him, get rid of him!”, they actually think they can get rid of me,’ Piers said ahead of the final results.

‘We’ve now had over 300,000 votes, one of the biggest in the history of the show, and it’s now moved 59% against me, now viewers, you’re not the snowflake brigade, you are my people.’

He added: ‘You are my army, I need you to get busy this morning. We cannot let the snowflakes win.’

A further campaign emerged on Change.org calling for Piers’ termination.

‘Morgan dictates to his viewers that it’s acceptable to deny an LGBTQ+ person of their rights; it’s acceptable to tell them they don’t exist; it’s acceptable to call them “snowflakes” when they get rightfully upset,’ part of the petition’s description reads.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
